verses.name: Psalms 32:1
verses.text: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.

verses.name: Psalms 32:2
verses.text: Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile.

verses.name: Psalms 32:3
verses.text: When I kept silence, my bones waxed old through my roaring all the day long.

verses.name: Psalms 32:4
verses.text: For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me: my moisture is turned into the drought of summer. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 32:5
verses.text: I acknowledged my sin unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid. I said, I will confess my transgressions unto the Lord; and thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 32:6
verses.text: For this shall every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found: surely in the floods of great waters they shall not come nigh unto him.

verses.name: Psalms 32:7
verses.text: Thou art my hiding place; thou shalt preserve me from trouble; thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 32:8
verses.text: I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.

verses.name: Psalms 32:9
verses.text: Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest they come near unto thee.

verses.name: Psalms 32:10
verses.text: Many sorrows shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him about.

verses.name: Psalms 32:11
verses.text: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
